name: karma

routers.commit_message_added:
A start to karma implementation with redis backend.
* Karma actions defined for answer, first answer, solution, helpful vote
* Behind 'karma' waffle switch
* /admin/karma page shows top contributors, allows user key lookup, and initializing karma.
* REDIS_TEST_BACKENDS settings used for tests
* SkipTest tests that depend on redis when the test backend(s) arent defined
* Added redis-test.conf

routers.commit_message_added:
Fix pagination problems with elastic search

* Paginating wasn't working correctly for questios or forum post search
  results.  The pages would get generated, but all results would be
  shown on every page.  A typo was preventing the question_s and
  discussion_s from picking up the sliced s.
* Also, this changes type_ to kind so it's less built-inny
* Quoting the comment I modified and added to:

  If we're doing elasticsearch, then we need to update
  the _s variables to point to the sliced versions of
  S so that, when we iterate over them in the
  following list comp, we hang onto the version that
  does the query, so we can call excerpt() on it
  later.

  We only need to do this with elasticsearch.  For Sphinx,
  search_s at this point is an ObjectResults and not an S
  because we've already acquired object_ids on it.  Thus
  if we update the _s variables, we'd be pointing to the
  ObjectResults and not the S and then excerpting breaks.

* This tests that excerpting works for elasticsearch.  If it works then
  it means that we're excerpting with the same S that we did the query
  with.
routers.commit_message_deleted: [bug 709807] Add e={es,sph} to search results page and result urls.

routers.commit_message_added: [bug 709807] Add e={es,sph} to search results page and result urls.

routers.commit_message_added:
[bug 731558, 729103] Handle ES errors in suggestions

This adds handling for ES-related issues like max retry, timeout,
exceptions, ... In these cases, _search_suggestions returns
an empty result set--that seems like the right thing to do.

routers.commit_message_added:
[728422] split search view into sphinx and es

* splits the search view into separate Sphinx and ES views
* removes Sphinx things from the ES view
* removes object_ids code from the ES view replacing it with ComposedList
* adds some TODO items to look at later
routers.commit_message_deleted:
[bug 755923] RIP Sphinx

This removes all the Sphinx-related stuff.

You may need to do:

    git rm --cached vendors/src/oedipus vendor/src/sphinxapi

to remove the vendor git submodule stuff.

routers.commit_message_added:
[bug 752519, 752517] Filter and Boost ES fixes

Prefixes all the fields making it easier to apply boosts on a model-field
level and makes it less likely filters will interfere with each other.

Reimplement query_fields so that the code is in kitsune rather than in
elasticutils

Split _search_suggestions in the new_question view so that we can do
ES-specific things in the ES version of the view.

Add some AAQ tests that make sure the new_question view isn't totally
dying in an unhandled way.

Removed weights because they were using the wrong keys which means that
they weren't having any effect. The weight keys were wrong. e.g. a weight
specified "title" but since we're querying with "title__text" it needed to
specify "title__text".

I also updated to an elasticutils sumo branch rev that has some tweaks
to the weight code which makes it clearer.

Also added some debugging.

Fixed the result template to be more generic making it easier for our
increasingly divergent ES and Sphinx code.

Fixes the model field so it's not stored in the index--that was silly.
"store" should only be used for data that will be highlighted. Otherwise
we pull it from the source.

Removed question_id and thread_id from the mapping--they were never used.

Whew!
routers.commit_message_deleted:
[bug 755923] RIP Sphinx

This removes all the Sphinx-related stuff.

You may need to do:

    git rm --cached vendors/src/oedipus vendor/src/sphinxapi

to remove the vendor git submodule stuff.

name: esunified

routers.commit_message_added:
bug 755726] Implement ES unified search results

This adds another search view which is accessible when elasticsearch
and esunified waffle flags are enabled.

This new view uses one S and thus all results are together sorted
by score rather than displayed in buckets.

This adds some basic tests--mostly the existing ES ones copied over
and put under the esunified=True flag.

name: search-ab

routers.commit_message_added:
[bug 790425] A/B test excerpt styles

This adds a search-ab waffle flag for future A/B testing of search
behavior.

I use it in this case to A/B test the excerpt style for support forum
questions.

* True/a shows the first 500 characters of the question_content.
* False/b shows 3 fragments of question_content as selected by ES.

After we're done A/B testing this, we can leave the search-ab stuff
in for the next round of A/B testing goodness.
routers.commit_message_deleted: [bug 799445] Keep highlighting option a: one fragment up to 500 chars.
